conclusion: Determine which container (D or E) the liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles.
Liquid flows from A straight down through the black and brown baffles.
Liquid from A continues downward and splits, moving towards the containers.
Liquid flows from B straight down through the cyan baffle.
The cyan baffle directs the liquid towards the right, towards container E.
Liquid flows from C straight down through the orange baffle.
The orange baffle directs the liquid towards the right, towards container E.
The flow paths from A and B indicate they both converge towards container E.
The flow from C also directs towards container E.
Since the majority of the flow paths lead towards container E, it is clear that container E will be filled by the liquid from points A, B, and C.
The liquid will flow into container E after passing through the baffles.
